paper_abstract: Let F be a set of functions of , where and . If for any -subset there exists at least one function such that is one-to-one, then is called a perfect hash family, denoted by PHF. In this paper, we construct the simplest nontrivial PHFs of and using classic generalized quadrangles, quadrics in PG and Hermitian varieties in PG. We obtained PHF and PHF for a prime power. The curve is greater than known for a prime power.
paper_title: Perfect hash families of strength three with three rows from varieties on finite projective geometries
